radiographic_examinations.findings: T2-weighted increased signal in both thalami, the pons, and cerebral peduncles.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After the first stroke-like episode (in 2007), MRI showed edema involving the entire hemicortex of the left cerebral hemisphere, except for the mesiotemporal regions. After the second event (in 2008), MRI showed new cortical edema with contrast enhancement of the right hemisphere.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Edema involving the entire hemicortex of the left cerebral hemisphere, except for the mesiotemporal regions.
Cortical necrosis of the left hemisphere, sparing the mesiotemporal cortex.
Left cortical sequelae and cortical edema of the right hemisphere, with cortical enhancement.
